parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the lower ball joint can cause the wheel to separate from the vehicle, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potential injuries or fatalities.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Electrical System Failure (Alternator, Battery, and Accessories)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the electrical system can cause the vehicle to stall, leaving the driver stranded, and in some cases, trap the occupants inside the vehicle due to malfunctioning power doors and windows.
symptoms: cigarette lighter burning out a fuse

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Vehicle Surge and Loss of Control due to Computer Chip Malfunction
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the computer chip can cause the vehicle to surge, leading to loss of control, especially when driving over 46 mph, which can result in accidents.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Premature Rack and Pinion Seal Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The premature failure of the rack and pinion seal can cause power steering fluid leaks, leading to loss of power steering assist, making it difficult to steer the vehicle, and potentially causing accidents.
A misaligned steering system can cause uneven tire wear, loose or wandering steering, and reduced vehicle stability, potentially leading to loss of control and accidents.
The failure of the brake system can cause the vehicle to lose stopping power, leading to accidents, injuries, and potentially even fatalities.
symptoms: The brakes resist or fail to engage
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual
the vehicle pulls to one side when braking
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the vehicle is unable to stop
resulting in loss of control or accidents.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Driver's Seat Belt Failure to Engage/Restrain
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the driver's seat belt to engage or restrain can lead to serious injuries or fatalities in the event of an accident, as the driver is not properly secured in their seat.
symptoms: The seat belt does not latch or engage properly
the seat belt fails to restrain the driver during an accident
the driver is not properly secured in their seat
the seat belt is loose or does not tighten properly.
